channel.title: Tea With Alice
channel.itunes:subtitle: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
channel.itunes:summary: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With a rotating cast of bright and brilliant guests.
channel.description: Every week Alice Fraser, chronic thinker, comedian, ex lawyer and cambridge graduate drinks tea and solves the world. With a rotating cast of bright and brilliant guests.

item.title: Kyran Wheatley Unwrapcast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Pottery, partnership and unwrapping toys. Alice sits in the new living room of the excellent Kyran Wheatley in Sydney. They talk about lies and liberalism, the fallacy of free will and what happens when you find yourself on the wrong side of an argument.
item.description: Pottery, partnership and unwrapping toys. Alice sits in the new living room of the excellent Kyran Wheatley in Sydney. They talk about lies and liberalism, the fallacy of free will and what happens when you find yourself on the wrong side of an argument.

item.title: Sami Shah Ship to Shahcast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Immigration, identity, invisibility, accents, money, laughing in the face of grief and being too good looking for television, Alice sits in her flat in Melbourne, talking to newly Melbournised Sami Shah about his dangerous ideas. She has tea, he has water, or as she likes to call it, pre-tea.
Sami can be found at @samishah on twitter
Alice is available at @aliterative
item.description:
Immigration, identity, invisibility, accents, money, laughing in the face of grief and being too good looking for television, Alice sits in her flat in Melbourne, talking to newly Melbournised Sami Shah about his dangerous ideas. She has tea, he has water, or as she likes to call it, pre-tea.
Sami can be found at @samishah on twitter
Alice is available at @aliterative

item.title: Josh Earlcast Bullying, Boys and Being Accountable
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Being publicly shamed, bringing up boys and being held accountable. Alice sits in Melbourne over Matcha, Macadam and Gyokuro, talking with Radio and Television personality, musician, comedian and brunet father of two, Josh Earl, about the ins and outs of discomfort, anger, and civil discourse.
Josh is available on twitter at @mrjoshearl, and Alice can be reached at @aliterative or http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Being publicly shamed, bringing up boys and being held accountable. Alice sits in Melbourne over Matcha, Macadam and Gyokuro, talking with Radio and Television personality, musician, comedian and brunet father of two, Josh Earl, about the ins and outs of discomfort, anger, and civil discourse.
Josh is available on twitter at @mrjoshearl, and Alice can be reached at @aliterative or http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Sam Streeter word on the Streetcast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser sits with Sam Streeter over late night Camomile and Turmeric tea, and discusses the life of the semi-pro audience member, how you get famous for laughing and the power dynamics of watching people get famous for twenty years.
Sam can be found online @samstreetr
Alice is online @aliterative
patreon.com/AliceFraser is the place to give support
item.description:
Alice Fraser sits with Sam Streeter over late night Camomile and Turmeric tea, and discusses the life of the semi-pro audience member, how you get famous for laughing and the power dynamics of watching people get famous for twenty years.
Sam can be found online @samstreetr
Alice is online @aliterative
patreon.com/AliceFraser is the place to give support

item.title: Guy Montgomery Man Mountain Mystery
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in her flat in Melbourne with NZ comedian Guy Montgomery and talks in and out of the depths of comedy, Wilosophical queries, the pitfalls of happiness and the risks of ambition.
Guy can be found on twitter @guy_mont
alice is online at @aliterative or patreon.com/AliceFraser
item.description:
Alice sits in her flat in Melbourne with NZ comedian Guy Montgomery and talks in and out of the depths of comedy, Wilosophical queries, the pitfalls of happiness and the risks of ambition.
Guy can be found on twitter @guy_mont
alice is online at @aliterative or patreon.com/AliceFraser

item.title: Ivan Aristigueta Sex and Chivalry in the third world
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits with Ivan Aristigueta over an Earl Grey Blend, milk no sugar, and talks about Political Correctness in the third world, Cultural relativism, chivalry and the problem with Cocaine.
Ivan can be found on @ivancomedy on Twitter
Alice is available at alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Alice sits with Ivan Aristigueta over an Earl Grey Blend, milk no sugar, and talks about Political Correctness in the third world, Cultural relativism, chivalry and the problem with Cocaine.
Ivan can be found on @ivancomedy on Twitter
Alice is available at alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: James Mackay - Hollywood Art Stylin
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in her flat in Fitzroy, Melbourne with hollywood film and stage actor James Mackay over Black Tea with Almond and Milk, while she drinks Matcha green tea. They discuss whether you're allowed to have an opinion in Hollywood, how acting is different from comedy, how you can deploy the authentic self on demand, what's wrong with language, wasting time on screens, charity muggers, WHALES
James Mackay is @jwmackay on twitter, and is on instagram
Alice is available at alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter @aliterative
item.description:
Alice sits in her flat in Fitzroy, Melbourne with hollywood film and stage actor James Mackay over Black Tea with Almond and Milk, while she drinks Matcha green tea. They discuss whether you're allowed to have an opinion in Hollywood, how acting is different from comedy, how you can deploy the authentic self on demand, what's wrong with language, wasting time on screens, charity muggers, WHALES
James Mackay is @jwmackay on twitter, and is on instagram
Alice is available at alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter @aliterative

item.title: Nikko Malyon - Bantercast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in Double Bay over straight Earl Grey and talks with Producer, FBi Radio host and all round good guy, Nikko Malyon about the language of clothes, the purpose of being and the impact of the internet.
Nikko can't be found online, but look up Green Lights Comedy Nights in Sydney and check him out.
Alice is available at alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter @aliterative
item.description:
Alice sits in Double Bay over straight Earl Grey and talks with Producer, FBi Radio host and all round good guy, Nikko Malyon about the language of clothes, the purpose of being and the impact of the internet.
Nikko can't be found online, but look up Green Lights Comedy Nights in Sydney and check him out.
Alice is available at alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter @aliterative

item.title: Ryan Coffey instead of Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Alice sits in her flat in Fitzroy, Melbourne with Comedian and man, Ryan Coffey in her flat in Fitzroy, in a high wind, and talks about love, priorities and moral choices, Aboriginal communities and the point of art.
item.description: Alice sits in her flat in Fitzroy, Melbourne with Comedian and man, Ryan Coffey in her flat in Fitzroy, in a high wind, and talks about love, priorities and moral choices, Aboriginal communities and the point of art.

item.title: Jen Carnovale - Extra CreamCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in Waterstones in London having tea with comedian and friend of the podcast Jen Carnovale.
They talk over black tea with scones, jam and extra cream about gravity, anxiety, depression, octopuses solving mazes, perception, meditation, passivity and reactions.
item.description:
Alice sits in Waterstones in London having tea with comedian and friend of the podcast Jen Carnovale.
They talk over black tea with scones, jam and extra cream about gravity, anxiety, depression, octopuses solving mazes, perception, meditation, passivity and reactions.

item.title: Winnie M Li in The Consentcast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser sits in a cafe in Edinburgh with writer, producer and activist Winnie M Li, to talk about rape, violence and consent over carrot cake and cups of tea.
Winnie M Li can be found at http://www.winniemli.com/
Alice is available on twitter at http://twitter.com/aliterative or online at alicecomedyfraser.com. She also has a patreon page at patreon.com/alicerfraser
item.description:
Alice Fraser sits in a cafe in Edinburgh with writer, producer and activist Winnie M Li, to talk about rape, violence and consent over carrot cake and cups of tea.
Winnie M Li can be found at http://www.winniemli.com/
Alice is available on twitter at http://twitter.com/aliterative or online at alicecomedyfraser.com. She also has a patreon page at patreon.com/alicerfraser

item.title: Ivor Dembina - Old Jewish Jokes
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in Edinburgh in the kitchen of her flat at 1 in the morning and talks to flatmate and load-bearing-pillar of the comedy community Ivor Dembina, about Palestine and Israel, fear, the wonders of the Internet, the importance of watching your mouth and the tattoo of the red shoes.
Ivor Dembina has a fb page http://facebook.com/ivor.dembina and a wikipedia page http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivor_Dembina
alice is available at @aliterative on twitter or via her website http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Alice sits in Edinburgh in the kitchen of her flat at 1 in the morning and talks to flatmate and load-bearing-pillar of the comedy community Ivor Dembina, about Palestine and Israel, fear, the wonders of the Internet, the importance of watching your mouth and the tattoo of the red shoes.
Ivor Dembina has a fb page http://facebook.com/ivor.dembina and a wikipedia page http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivor_Dembina
alice is available at @aliterative on twitter or via her website http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: John Hastings not speedscast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser sits in the National Library of Scotland Cafe with John Hastings, drinking green tea and eating biscuits. They discuss how eyes work, contract law, the value of lawyers, ambient noise, pornography and why Alice doesn't like sandwiches.
You can look up John Hastings http://johnhastingscomedy.com/ or on twitter at @thejohnhastings
Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter at @aliterative
item.description:
Alice Fraser sits in the National Library of Scotland Cafe with John Hastings, drinking green tea and eating biscuits. They discuss how eyes work, contract law, the value of lawyers, ambient noise, pornography and why Alice doesn't like sandwiches.
You can look up John Hastings http://johnhastingscomedy.com/ or on twitter at @thejohnhastings
Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter at @aliterative

item.title: Greg Dickens Was blind, but now can see cast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice (new zoom mic!) sits with her old friend Greg Dickens in a house near Cambridge, and talks about his job as an inventor, eating disorders, monkeys (and apes), suddenly going blind in deepest darkest africa, public nudity, existential fear, maths to the nearest whatever, getting your girl on board the marriage train, and the big red button.
Greg is available online as undercoversuperhero
Alice, still unwilling to reveal her superhero alterego is still @aliterative
item.description:
Alice (new zoom mic!) sits with her old friend Greg Dickens in a house near Cambridge, and talks about his job as an inventor, eating disorders, monkeys (and apes), suddenly going blind in deepest darkest africa, public nudity, existential fear, maths to the nearest whatever, getting your girl on board the marriage train, and the big red button.
Greg is available online as undercoversuperhero
Alice, still unwilling to reveal her superhero alterego is still @aliterative

item.title: Penny Durham for your Thoughts
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice drinks Rooibos in the About Life Cafe in Darlinghurst with Penny Durham, who is drinking Chai. They talk about reviewing comedy, the problems of words, causation and correlation and the lowest common denominator.
Penny's writing can be found on twitter a @pennydee or in The Australian.
Alice is available at alicerfraser@gmail.com or @aliterative on twitter
item.description:
Alice drinks Rooibos in the About Life Cafe in Darlinghurst with Penny Durham, who is drinking Chai. They talk about reviewing comedy, the problems of words, causation and correlation and the lowest common denominator.
Penny's writing can be found on twitter a @pennydee or in The Australian.
Alice is available at alicerfraser@gmail.com or @aliterative on twitter

item.title: Toby Truslove - All you need is
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in her echoey living room in Fitzroy, chatting with Toby Truslove about plots, devices, comedy, performance and life.
Toby can be found on a screen somewhere, or avoiding social media.
Alice is available via alicecomedyfraser.com or at @aliterative on twitter
item.description:
Alice sits in her echoey living room in Fitzroy, chatting with Toby Truslove about plots, devices, comedy, performance and life.
Toby can be found on a screen somewhere, or avoiding social media.
Alice is available via alicecomedyfraser.com or at @aliterative on twitter

item.title: sex, art, work and suicide, with reet who used to be gia james
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in her little place in Melbourne over Italian Almond Black Tea and sesame mochi with Reet (@Suburbang0th). They talk about suicide, anger, grief, beauty and art.
Warnings: graphic discussions of suicide, language.
email alice on alicerfraser@gmail.com
item.description:
Alice sits in her little place in Melbourne over Italian Almond Black Tea and sesame mochi with Reet (@Suburbang0th). They talk about suicide, anger, grief, beauty and art.
Warnings: graphic discussions of suicide, language.
email alice on alicerfraser@gmail.com

item.title: Lawrence Leung - Leung full of Aircast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits with Lawrence Leung in Grub Food Van and Kitchen, over a Jasmine Pearl tea talking ghosts, magic, film-making, random acts of kindness, comedians vs actors, form vs function and fighting the fear.
Lawrence can be found at http://lawrenceleung.com
Alice can be found at http://alicefraser.com
item.description:
Alice sits with Lawrence Leung in Grub Food Van and Kitchen, over a Jasmine Pearl tea talking ghosts, magic, film-making, random acts of kindness, comedians vs actors, form vs function and fighting the fear.
Lawrence can be found at http://lawrenceleung.com
Alice can be found at http://alicefraser.com

item.title: Lawrence Mooney - Waxing Mooncast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in a loud cafe with Lawrence Mooney, having rooibos and black tea (with milk) in Adelaide. They discuss Slavery, Siblings, Time, Workplace incentives, Beauty, Truth and Sexual Politics.
Lawrence Mooney can be found online at @lawrencemooney or on Dirty Laundry Live
Alice is available for chats at @aliterative on twitter or via her website
item.description:
Alice sits in a loud cafe with Lawrence Mooney, having rooibos and black tea (with milk) in Adelaide. They discuss Slavery, Siblings, Time, Workplace incentives, Beauty, Truth and Sexual Politics.
Lawrence Mooney can be found online at @lawrencemooney or on Dirty Laundry Live
Alice is available for chats at @aliterative on twitter or via her website

item.title: Units of ComedyCast - Andy Matthews
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser sits in the Victorian State Library with Andy Matthews who is full of hot chocolate. They talk about comedy, poetry, engineering, time travel and being zoo exhibits.
Find Andy on twitter at @stupidoldandy
find alice at alicerfraser@gmail.com
item.description:
Alice Fraser sits in the Victorian State Library with Andy Matthews who is full of hot chocolate. They talk about comedy, poetry, engineering, time travel and being zoo exhibits.
Find Andy on twitter at @stupidoldandy
find alice at alicerfraser@gmail.com

item.title: Rebel HeartCast - Georgie Carroll
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Anarchy in the Australia
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser sits in the house of her cousin the Space Archeologist in Adelaide and talks to Georgie Carroll, maverick, nurse, mother and comedian about anarchy, violence, sex, comedy and recycling.
Hit Alice up on her patreon, or at alice r fraser at gmail.com
item.description:
Alice Fraser sits in the house of her cousin the Space Archeologist in Adelaide and talks to Georgie Carroll, maverick, nurse, mother and comedian about anarchy, violence, sex, comedy and recycling.
Hit Alice up on her patreon, or at alice r fraser at gmail.com

item.title: Weight loss, Death and Black CoffeeCast - Dilruk Jayasingha
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in a Malaysian Cafe with Melbourne Comedian Dilruk Jayasingha. They talk about weight loss, family and the spectre of death. Also some shop talk about comedy.
Dilruk is followable on twitter @DilrukJ
Alice is available at @aliterative
item.description:
Alice sits in a Malaysian Cafe with Melbourne Comedian Dilruk Jayasingha. They talk about weight loss, family and the spectre of death. Also some shop talk about comedy.
Dilruk is followable on twitter @DilrukJ
Alice is available at @aliterative

item.title: Alice on Alicecast talking Comedy as Therapy
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser sits in the State Library of Victoria in Melbourne City and talks to herself about moving to Melbourne, Comedy as Therapy, Expressing fury through Blog Posts, the point of doing art about Death and the future of the Teacast.
look her up at @aliterative
http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Alice Fraser sits in the State Library of Victoria in Melbourne City and talks to herself about moving to Melbourne, Comedy as Therapy, Expressing fury through Blog Posts, the point of doing art about Death and the future of the Teacast.
look her up at @aliterative
http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Goldstein Shower - Mike Goldstein
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Monogamy in the Basement
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser sits downstairs in a store room at the Mercure Hotel in Melbourne during MICF and talks to Mike Goldstein about serial monogamy, fighting, love-drugs, difficult hecklers, marriage counselling, divorce law.
Mike is available on twitter @mikegstein
Alice is on twitter @aliterative
item.description:
Alice Fraser sits downstairs in a store room at the Mercure Hotel in Melbourne during MICF and talks to Mike Goldstein about serial monogamy, fighting, love-drugs, difficult hecklers, marriage counselling, divorce law.
Mike is available on twitter @mikegstein
Alice is on twitter @aliterative

item.title: Licking Glory with Penny Greenhalgh
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: On the Run
item.itunes:summary:
Alice and Penny Greenhalgh sit in a couple of different places, get chased around the Mercure hotel and talk about Meat, Squid Ice Cream, Mice watching TV, Graceful Awkwardness, Violent Crass Comedy, the man who keeps asking us to move.
Follow Penny on Twitter @pennygreenhalgh
A good point of reference for awkward grace is here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wk7-lhARaSc
Follow me on twitter @aliterative or my website http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Alice and Penny Greenhalgh sit in a couple of different places, get chased around the Mercure hotel and talk about Meat, Squid Ice Cream, Mice watching TV, Graceful Awkwardness, Violent Crass Comedy, the man who keeps asking us to move.
Follow Penny on Twitter @pennygreenhalgh
A good point of reference for awkward grace is here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wk7-lhARaSc
Follow me on twitter @aliterative or my website http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Gareth Reynolds - Gary Me Home
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Tea and Politics
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks to Gareth “Gary” Reynolds about tea, crazy fans, eating dogs, short term thinking, phone etiquette, Little Kevin and bad gigs.
With dad-finding-teacups-and-going-shopping-cameo from Dave Anthony
Gareth can be found at @reynoldsgareth
item.description:
Alice talks to Gareth “Gary” Reynolds about tea, crazy fans, eating dogs, short term thinking, phone etiquette, Little Kevin and bad gigs.
With dad-finding-teacups-and-going-shopping-cameo from Dave Anthony
Gareth can be found at @reynoldsgareth

item.title: Myq-sing it up - Myq Kaplan
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Alice sits upstairs in the Victoria Hotel in Melbourne with Myq Kaplan to talk about Veganism, Non-Monogamy, the Ten Commandments, Queer Identity for the Straight Guy, Constitutional Literalism
item.description: Alice sits upstairs in the Victoria Hotel in Melbourne with Myq Kaplan to talk about Veganism, Non-Monogamy, the Ten Commandments, Queer Identity for the Straight Guy, Constitutional Literalism

item.title: Tasting Hastings - John Hastings
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Less Haste More Speed
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in the top of the Producers bar in Adelaide, talking to Best of The Edinburgh Fest act and all round good guy John Hastings. They talk about sleeping your way to the top, contract law, complicated grief, reading reviews, fame-orgies and maturity.
John is Online at: http://www.johnhastingscomedy.com
Alice is available at: http://www.alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Alice sits in the top of the Producers bar in Adelaide, talking to Best of The Edinburgh Fest act and all round good guy John Hastings. They talk about sleeping your way to the top, contract law, complicated grief, reading reviews, fame-orgies and maturity.
John is Online at: http://www.johnhastingscomedy.com
Alice is available at: http://www.alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Fingers in the Fosdyke - James Fosdyke
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Mental Illness Fun times in Adelaide
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits upstairs at the Producers Bar in Adelaide and talks to James Fosdyke, influential podcast-artist and general good guy. They talk quality control, comic books, podcasts, Wil Anderson's patronage, fan service and self loathing, depression and suicide.
James Fosdyke's work can be found at http://http://www.visualante.com.au/
Alice Fraser is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com as always or on twitter at @aliterative
item.description:
Alice sits upstairs at the Producers Bar in Adelaide and talks to James Fosdyke, influential podcast-artist and general good guy. They talk quality control, comic books, podcasts, Wil Anderson's patronage, fan service and self loathing, depression and suicide.
James Fosdyke's work can be found at http://http://www.visualante.com.au/
Alice Fraser is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com as always or on twitter at @aliterative

item.title: Untangled Webb - Lindsay Webb
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in the Rhino Room in Adelaide and talks to legendary touring comedian Lindsay Webb about Public Transport, Capitalism, Jobs, High Culture, Low Culture and Agriculture.
Lindsay is accessible online at http://twitter.com/lindswebb
Alice is available at http://alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter at http://www.twitter.com/aliterative
item.description:
Alice sits in the Rhino Room in Adelaide and talks to legendary touring comedian Lindsay Webb about Public Transport, Capitalism, Jobs, High Culture, Low Culture and Agriculture.
Lindsay is accessible online at http://twitter.com/lindswebb
Alice is available at http://alicecomedyfraser.com or on twitter at http://www.twitter.com/aliterative

item.title: JockShock Teacast - Paul Solomon
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Peppermint Tea
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in the basement of one of her oldest friends, fellow buddhist and ex-breakfast-radio jock Paul 'Paulie P' Solomon, talking about all sorts of awful things, word facts, Radio politics, getting angry, childhood, travel, brotherhood and consent.
Paulie is on twitter @mrpauliep
Alice can be found at http://www.alicecomedyfraser.com or on Twitter at @aliterative
item.description:
Alice sits in the basement of one of her oldest friends, fellow buddhist and ex-breakfast-radio jock Paul 'Paulie P' Solomon, talking about all sorts of awful things, word facts, Radio politics, getting angry, childhood, travel, brotherhood and consent.
Paulie is on twitter @mrpauliep
Alice can be found at http://www.alicecomedyfraser.com or on Twitter at @aliterative

item.title: Stripping for Jesus Jarrod McKenna
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Stripping for Jesus, sex advice from a man of Christ. Legal tips for the Peaceful Activist (with state differences), and the thing we weren't going to talk about. Alice sits in Perth, and has Jasmine Green tea with Jarrod McKenna, activist and peace prize winner.
Look up the hashtag #lovemakesaway and google the First home project.
Look up Alice on http://alicecomedyfraser.com or follow her on twitter at http://twitter.com/aliterative
item.description:
Stripping for Jesus, sex advice from a man of Christ. Legal tips for the Peaceful Activist (with state differences), and the thing we weren't going to talk about. Alice sits in Perth, and has Jasmine Green tea with Jarrod McKenna, activist and peace prize winner.
Look up the hashtag #lovemakesaway and google the First home project.
Look up Alice on http://alicecomedyfraser.com or follow her on twitter at http://twitter.com/aliterative

item.title: Ultraviolent JohnCast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary: Alice Fraser sits in the London flat of Australian cult comedian, gaming celebrity and bottle blond John Robertson. They drink tea and discuss hyper-caffeination, the difference between ultraviolence and domestic violence, the modern Australian Novel, Kurt Vonnegut, lawyers' dreams, bondage, teeth and John's dangerous ideas.
item.description: Alice Fraser sits in the London flat of Australian cult comedian, gaming celebrity and bottle blond John Robertson. They drink tea and discuss hyper-caffeination, the difference between ultraviolence and domestic violence, the modern Australian Novel, Kurt Vonnegut, lawyers' dreams, bondage, teeth and John's dangerous ideas.

item.title: Tiff in a Teacup - Tiffany Stevenson
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in Camden with Tiff Stevenson and tea, talking about Drag, Gender, Crime, Bullying and being recognised in the street.
Tiff's website is here: http://www.tiffstevenson.co.uk
Alice is here: http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Alice sits in Camden with Tiff Stevenson and tea, talking about Drag, Gender, Crime, Bullying and being recognised in the street.
Tiff's website is here: http://www.tiffstevenson.co.uk

item.title: Herocast Podcast - Helen Zaltzman
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in the UK, land of Tea and does a podcast in the Scandinavian kitchen with Helen Zaltzman who is incredibly cool.
Listen
helen is @helenzaltzman on twitter
Alice is @aliterative
Bryce Halliday is excellent @mrbrycehalliday
email her on alicerfraser@gmail.com or visit the website on http://alicecomedyfraser.com

Alice sits in the UK, land of Tea and does a podcast in the Scandinavian kitchen with Helen Zaltzman who is incredibly cool.

helen is @helenzaltzman on twitter

item.title: Pat the Rodcast - Patrick Brown and Roderick Makim
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Politics and News
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits and drinks warm water with Roderick Makim (Journalist) and Patrick Brown, (Lawyer, Autodidact and Middle East non-expert ex-ex-pat). They talk about Charlie Hebdo, Generalising from Extremism, and whether you should follow the news at all.
Pat is at http://twitter.com/pjbow and Roderick is at http://twitter.com/roderickmakim
Their podcast "Pat and Rod Save The World" is here: https://itunes.apple.com/au/podcast/pat-and-rod-save-the-world/id920725924?mt=2
Alice is at http://twitter.com/aliterative or http://alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
Alice sits and drinks warm water with Roderick Makim (Journalist) and Patrick Brown, (Lawyer, Autodidact and Middle East non-expert ex-ex-pat). They talk about Charlie Hebdo, Generalising from Extremism, and whether you should follow the news at all.
Pat is at http://twitter.com/pjbow and Roderick is at http://twitter.com/roderickmakim
Their podcast "Pat and Rod Save The World" is here: https://itunes.apple.com/au/podcast/pat-and-rod-save-the-world/id920725924?mt=2

item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Acronyms up the butt

Gia can be found on twitter @GiaJamesxxx
Alice is @aliterative or alice r fraser at gmail

item.title: Special Episode Re-Release of Lucy Fraser Episode
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: By Request
item.itunes:summary:
This episode is the full audio of the conversation that I had with my mum Lucy Fraser for episode 33. I was asked to release it without my original introduction.
There are a few extra seconds of audio, and a poem at the end.

item.title: Tom Ballard Pod-Tom or The Ball-cast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Peppermint Tea
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in Tom Ballard's nice house and talks over tea and unnecessarily vegan biscuits about Grief, belief, how blowjobs are stardust, why Alice wants to ban feelings, how everyone's bad at maths, International Pretend There's No Afterlife Day, the movie Fury (no spoilers).
Note, before this Podcast, Alice Fraser fixed Tom Ballard's Dishwasher like a champion.
Tell Tom Ballard to do his own podcast at tomballard.com.au
Alice is available on alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Doublevisioncast - Tegan Higginbotham
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Is it me or does Tegan sound a lot like me?
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks about someone who made her angry and then has tea with Melbourne comedian and future big star, Tegan Higginbotham about the difficult things in a cafe in Melbourne that also happened to be a shipping container. Melbourne is so cool.
Tegan is on Twitter at https://twitter.com/TeganMH
Alice is online at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

Alice is online at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Teach a Man to Fishcast - Jim Fishwick
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Hipster Paradox - Schroedinger's Ironic Moustache
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks to Jim Fishwick over tea about the terrible mistake she made on stage that night, hipsterism, what artform their comedy would be if it weren't comedy and what the future holds for everything
item.description: Alice talks to Jim Fishwick over tea about the terrible mistake she made on stage that night, hipsterism, what artform their comedy would be if it weren't comedy and what the future holds for everything

item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Keep oldies off the Ice-Floes
item.itunes:summary:
Victoria Healy and Josh Dore come down from Melbourne to have Tea With Alice. They talk about talking about sex, killing old people, and how Bondi Beach is very much like a country town.
Vic is at http://victoriahealy.com Josh is on twitter at @joshdore Alice is online at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Giant Squid and Anarchy PowerCast - Damien Power
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:summary:
Alice has tea and talks to wild comedian, father, thinker and queenslander, Damien Power. They ramble through politics, social structures, post-apocalyptic train journeys and how ducks think about death.
alicecomedyfraser.com is the website to find all the recent things she's been working on and damien power is available at damienpower.com

item.title: Mugglecast - Daniel Muggleton
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Short, sweet and bullying
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks a bit of good and a bit of bad to Daniel Muggleton, one half of the mug and kettle open mic empire. Bryce Halliday is there at the beginning and chipping in along the way. Alice bullies Daniel and finally gets to the truth.
Daniel Muggleton is on twitter at @muggletown Edited by Bryce Halliday - brycehalliday.com Alice is alicecomedyfraser.com and @aliterative as ever. Email her on alicerfraser@gmail.com

item.title: Right of ReplyCast - Lucy Fraser
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Bringing it back to the Womb
item.itunes:summary: Alice has tea with the mother of dragons (if by dragons you mean Alice, and you do). They talk about poetry, music, M.S and Cancer, and how Lucy Fraser feels about being used in Alice's material.
item.description: Alice has tea with the mother of dragons (if by dragons you mean Alice, and you do). They talk about poetry, music, M.S and Cancer, and how Lucy Fraser feels about being used in Alice's material.

item.title: Airless CarCast - Claire Hooper and Women of Letters
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Running out of Oxygen, but still full of ideas.
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in a car with Claire Hooper in the carpark of Splendour in The Grass. As they slowly run out of oxygen, they talk about anxiety, what's the point of the news, the ethical downsides of being right about anything, Alice's million dollar idea, and how Claire as a new mother feels sorry for Pedophiles.
Appended at the end is Alice's Women of Letters performance, for people who don't mind sad things that aren't funny.
Thanks to Bryce Halliday for the Audio Edit. http://brycehalliday.com Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com Claire is at http://clairehooper.com
item.description:
Alice sits in a car with Claire Hooper in the carpark of Splendour in The Grass. As they slowly run out of oxygen, they talk about anxiety, what's the point of the news, the ethical downsides of being right about anything, Alice's million dollar idea, and how Claire as a new mother feels sorry for Pedophiles.
Appended at the end is Alice's Women of Letters performance, for people who don't mind sad things that aren't funny.
Thanks to Bryce Halliday for the Audio Edit. http://brycehalliday.com Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com Claire is at http://clairehooper.com

item.title: CapperCast Teacast - Nick Capper
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Values and all that
item.itunes:summary:
In a cavernous cafe in Melbourne, Alice sits down with Nick Capper and talks about the value of value, whether we should be careful or not careful with what we say and a lot of other things.
This chat happened chronologically BEFORE last week's chat with Toby Halligan, so some of the ideas here are amoebic forms of what was discussed 'last week'. Ah, time travel.
Hit Alice up on alicerfraser@gmail.com or go to the website alicecomedyfraser.com
item.description:
In a cavernous cafe in Melbourne, Alice sits down with Nick Capper and talks about the value of value, whether we should be careful or not careful with what we say and a lot of other things.
This chat happened chronologically BEFORE last week's chat with Toby Halligan, so some of the ideas here are amoebic forms of what was discussed 'last week'. Ah, time travel.

item.title: OffenseCast Teacast - Toby Halligan
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Political is Personal vs Generalities of Identity Politics
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks in a fancy boulangerie slash teahouse in Melbourne with Toby Halligan during his lunchbreak. Toby is a writer for The Project, creater and facilitator of political comedy all over Australia and just a generally interesting and cool guy. They discuss giant sandwiches, scurrilous comedy scene gossip, identity politics and what's the best way to take offense.
Toby is online at www.tobyhalligan.com.au and Alice is available (as ever) on http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking to the movement
item.itunes:summary:
Alice sits in her favourite Tea Shop and talks to Fred Winner and Barry Award Nominee Trygve Wakenshaw about being an apprentice vegan, what it's like being like nobody else, Status, Prizes, Astrology and Death.
Trygve can be found at http://trygvewakenshaw.net
Alice is at http://alicecomedyfraser.com or @aliterative
Note the much better sound quality? YEAH! Editing by the excellent Bryce Halliday (http://brycehalliday.com)

item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Morality of Cake
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks with comedian and writer Laura Davis about the Morality of Cake, different kinds of strength, child abuse, why peer pressure works, and why good people let bad things happen to them.
item.description: Alice talks with comedian and writer Laura Davis about the Morality of Cake, different kinds of strength, child abuse, why peer pressure works, and why good people let bad things happen to them.

item.title: Aspirational Punchingcast - Adam Yardley Returns
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Return of the Dad-Cast
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks in Glebe's WellCo cafe with Adam Yardley. They eat eggs on toast and drink chalky green tea and talk about reading playboy for the articles, Alice's recent almost viral article, walking into traffic, islamophobia and provocateurism.
item.description: Alice talks in Glebe's WellCo cafe with Adam Yardley. They eat eggs on toast and drink chalky green tea and talk about reading playboy for the articles, Alice's recent almost viral article, walking into traffic, islamophobia and provocateurism.

item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Manliness and Confidence
item.itunes:summary: Alice talks with friend and comedy writer Adam Yardley over some awesome sencha about manliness, being a stay at home dad, time travel and performance enhancing drugs for corporate women.

item.title: The Luce-Cast - Lucy Howard Taylor
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Birds and The Boys
item.itunes:summary: Alice Fraser talks to Lucy Howard Taylor and some incidental rainbow lorrikeets over a quick lunch in the Rocks. Lucy is a writer, poet and arts administrator in the Sydney Theatre Company and they chat about Rap, the fraught nature of having opinions, authenticity and how Zombies are like teenage boys.

Lucy is a writer, poet and arts administrator in the Sydney Theatre Company and they chat about Rap, the fraught nature of having opinions, authenticity and how Zombies are like teenage boys.

item.title: Nothing Susscast - Tami Sussman
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Parallel Lifecast
item.itunes:summary:
Alice Fraser talks to weirdly similar and yet excitingly different middle-name-sharing Tami Sussman performance poet, wedding celebrant and standup comedian. They have probably jasmine green tea and chat about The Salmon Lady, what's wrong with people who seem too normal, why the vibrator is a lie and the amazing thing about vests. With brief cameo from Henry Fraser.
Tami can be found on twitter at @sussmania Alice is all at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Overcast Teacast - Melbourne Dreaming
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sean and Alice talk about bigotry and Festival Marketing
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk about Bigotry and Festival Marketing. Warning - heavier on comedy discussion than usual.
(note: Slightly quiet volume wise. So listen somewhere chilled out.) 1min - The Danger of Energy Drinks 3mins - Panic Naps and Chronic Stress 10mins - The Exciting Bigotry of Hecklers 13mins - Creating a Brand 28mins - Tindr Marketing 29.50mins - Love induced erectile dysfunction 33mins - Getting really good at forgetting everything 35.50 - The Zombie Apocalypse 42.10 - Disability and Intellectual Snobbery 44.40 - Is it worth being happy for an hour 47.20 - Madness and Sadness, the Conversation takes a sad turn.
SHOW DETAILS Sean Michaels "I Wasn't Sean Yesterday" - Tuxedo Cat #MICF Alice Fraser "Everyone's A Winner" - Swanston Hotel, 8.30pm
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative
item.description:
Sean and Alice talk about Bigotry and Festival Marketing. Warning - heavier on comedy discussion than usual.
(note: Slightly quiet volume wise. So listen somewhere chilled out.) 1min - The Danger of Energy Drinks 3mins - Panic Naps and Chronic Stress 10mins - The Exciting Bigotry of Hecklers 13mins - Creating a Brand 28mins - Tindr Marketing 29.50mins - Love induced erectile dysfunction 33mins - Getting really good at forgetting everything 35.50 - The Zombie Apocalypse 42.10 - Disability and Intellectual Snobbery 44.40 - Is it worth being happy for an hour 47.20 - Madness and Sadness, the Conversation takes a sad turn.
SHOW DETAILS Sean Michaels "I Wasn't Sean Yesterday" - Tuxedo Cat #MICF Alice Fraser "Everyone's A Winner" - Swanston Hotel, 8.30pm
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Tea's A Crowd or a Fourcast Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Adam Yardley, Fiona Yardley and Richard Parkin and A Baby and A Plane
item.itunes:summary:
Alice has tea and talks in a remarkably civilised fourway throwdown about violence and criminality. Chapter titles if you want to skip ahead or back are as follows:
4.50 minutes in – Punching for no reason. 9.05 mins – Gendered dreams [do babies dream of electric babies?]. 13.20 – Aggression as a problem solving tool, violent fantasies and masculine heroism. 17 mins – The righteous smashing! 20 mins – A heavily visual joke… 21 mins - Swimming in salt water; complicated grief. 24 mins – The transcendental beauty of the imperfect... 26 mins – Criminality and Criminology. 30 mins – No-one wants to be an arsehole? 33 mins - Passive Aggression is not that bad.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Quali-Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sweet mics and hot conversation
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice take tea and talk no regrets, secular churches, the idea of friends with benefits, left handed people, relationship evolution, theme parks and some other stuff.
Sean's back and the original teacast two slide a sweet sounding show smoothly into your ear holes.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com or subscribe on itunes

item.title: Trapped in an Industrial Fancast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Sean Returns
item.itunes:summary: Despite the ominous 'womm wommm' noise, this tea was delightful and lighthearted. Sean and Alice have tea and talk about how having a broken headlight is like being cheated on, how Sean secretly doesn't want to sleep with every girl he dates. We discuss babushka dolls, when you want to be making risky decisions and how to be the master(bater) of your own destiny.
item.description: Despite the ominous 'womm wommm' noise, this tea was delightful and lighthearted. Sean and Alice have tea and talk about how having a broken headlight is like being cheated on, how Sean secretly doesn't want to sleep with every girl he dates. We discuss babushka dolls, when you want to be making risky decisions and how to be the master(bater) of your own destiny.

item.title: Tea with Greg Fleetcast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Bookshop Junkies
item.itunes:summary:
Alice and Greg Fleet have tea in a bookshop cafe. They talk flirting, punching Hitler, sympathy for pedophiles, anger management and how to destroy a friendship.
Look out for Greg Fleet at a comedy festival near you. Tickets available online.
http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: A Modest Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Swift and psychology, tea to the Max
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk over tea about how love is an addiction, bad investments, getting out while you're on top, and then play out an upsetting rant on a (non) alternative to the refugee crisis.
If you like the podcast, rate and review it on itunes, or recommend it to your friends. Visit Alice at - http://alicecomedyfraser.com @aliterative

item.title: Love Me Tindercast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Taking a swipe at modern love
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice have tea and talk about compliments, modern love, disco-ball surgery and the worst kind of profiling.
Alice loves the idea of marriage, but wants to propose an alternative for people that are less certain about the 'as long as we both shall live' part.
subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it.
Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com
http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Twincast Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Double Trouble with the Fraser Twins
item.itunes:summary:
Alice talks to her twin brother in a cafe in Oxford about criticism, self-doubt and the self indulgence of kickstarter.
Sean's offline again this week, so sound quality is Alice-style, and we're rocking a slightly late release.
see Henry's music at http://henryfraser.com subscribe to the podcast in itunes, if you're enjoying it. Send feedback at @aliterative or alicerfraser@gmail.com

item.title: Half-cast teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Twice the Tea, None of the Sean
item.itunes:summary:
All alone in England, Alice pulls a conversation out of the archives for the first Guest Teacast. With Scott Huntington, talking about men's rights activists, and deja-poo.
Find Scott's music online at http://listn.to/socalledfriend Alice is online at http://alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Teacast all the way to the Bank
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Catfished by a Corporation
item.itunes:summary:
Sean and Alice talk about how corporations aren't people too, how it's not good to get too close to your money, and how to avoid a spiral of liking that ends in marriage.
(slightly shorter than usual, as Alice is in England and cut out a thing and couldn't figure out how to replace it with another thing)
alicecomedyfraser.com

item.title: Teacast Art Imitating Lifecast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Third Time Lucky
item.itunes:summary: Sean tells a joke that you will never hear, Alice rants about whether art is or is not a luxury and the urge to create or play video games. They reflect on corporate life.
item.description: Sean tells a joke that you will never hear, Alice rants about whether art is or is not a luxury and the urge to create or play video games. They reflect on corporate life.

item.title: Teacast predator vs alienation
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's be Positive (about consent)
item.itunes:summary: Strap yourselves in. Alice educates Sean about dubious consent, they talk about smoke and mirrors, the jazz hands part of sex and what happens when a bird flies into the window.
item.description: Strap yourselves in. Alice educates Sean about dubious consent, they talk about smoke and mirrors, the jazz hands part of sex and what happens when a bird flies into the window.

item.title: Post Christmas Teacast
item.itunes:author: Alice Fraser
item.itunes:subtitle: The Birth of the Gripes Child
item.itunes:summary: Alice has tea with Sean. They talk about pride, love and loss, and school. Alice rants about goodwill to all mankind, and Sean talks about breakups with a friend.
item.description: Alice has tea with Sean. They talk about pride, love and loss, and school. Alice rants about goodwill to all mankind, and Sean talks about breakups with a friend.
